summary.para: Returns configuration data for the output protection system. The configuration data is used to enable or disable the protection system, and to set the protection levels.

param.name: pdwVal
param.para: Receives the configuration data. The meaning of this data depends on the output protection system.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Retrieves a GUID identifying the input trust authority (ITA) that generated this output schema object.

param.name: pguidOriginatorID
param.para: Receives a GUID that identifies the originating ITA.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: All of the policy objects and output schemas from the same ITA should return the same originator identifier (including dynamic policy changes). This value enables the OTA to distinguish policies that originate from different ITAs, so that the OTA can update dynamic policies correctly.

summary.para: Retrieves the output protection system that is represented by this object. Output protection systems are identified by GUID value.

param.name: pguidSchemaType
param.para: Receives the GUID that identifies the output protection system.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Encapsulates information about an output protection system and its corresponding configuration data.

remarks.para: If the configuration information for the output protection system does not require more than a DWORD of space, the configuration information is retrieved in the method. If more than a DWORD of configuration information is needed, it is stored using the interface.
